member.name: P:Rebex.Net.IFtp.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time in milliseconds before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is 60000 (60 seconds).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server. This also means that data transfers only time out after x milliseconds of inactivity, not after x milliseconds from the start of the transfer.
The property only affects synchronous methods. To time out asynchronous methods, use the method.
Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.ISocketExt.BeginListen(Rebex.Net.ISocket,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts an asynchronously request to listen for an incoming connection using the specified control socket as a base.
member.param: The control socket to use as a base.
The delegate.
An object containing state information for this request.
member.returns: An that references the asynchronous request.

remarks.p:
This method differs from System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Listen:
A control connection socket needs to be specified. This might be needed by a proxy server socket.
Only a single incoming connection is accepted. To accept an incoming connection, use the Accept or BeginAccept/EndAccept methods.
Note: When connected through a HTTP proxy server, this method will fail.

member.returns: The endpoint to which a connection from a remote host can be made.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.ProxySocket
member.summary: Implements the subset of the Berkeley sockets interface; adds the ability to connect through SOCKS4/SOCKS5 and HTTP proxies.

remarks.p: This class is suitable for extending your client applications with the ability to connect through proxies.
This class is limited to operations supported by proxies - it is not a replacement for the . This means it is perfect for writing clients, but useless for writing servers.
Only connection-oriented protocols are supported at the moment

The delegate.
An object containing state information for this request.

The BeginSend method starts asynchronously sending data through a ProxySocket. You should create a callback method that implements the AsyncCallback delegate. This callback method should use the EndSend method to complete the asynchronous operation. See the .NET Framework SDK Reference for more information on asynchronous methods.

remarks.p:
This method differs from :
A control connection socket needs to be specified. This might be needed by a proxy server socket.
Only a single incoming connection is accepted. To accept an incoming connection, use the method.
Note: When connected through a HTTP proxy server, this method will fail.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SshParameters.Compression
member.summary:
On clients, gets or sets a value indicating whether to prefer communication compression if supported by the server.
On servers, gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable or disable communication compression.
member.value: True to prefer or enable compression; False to not prefer or not enable compression (default).

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SshParameters.CompressionLevel
member.summary:
Gets or sets the compression level to be used if compression takes effect.
Possible values are 0-9, where 0 means no compression (fastest) and 9 means best compression (slowest). 5 (medium compression and speed) is a default value.
This only affects outgoing data.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.SshPrivateKey.Save(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Saves the private key into the supplied stream in Base64-encoded PKCS #8 format.
member.param: A stream to which to save the private key.
Password to encrypted the private key, or null if no encryption desired.
The algorithm to use for encryption. Ignored if password is null. Null defaults to "3DES".
member.remarks:
The encryptionAlgorithm can accepts a String or a Type. Currently, the following strings and types are accepted:
TripleDES: null, "3DES", "TripleDES", "1.2.840.113549.3.7", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDES)
DES: "DES", "1.3.14.3.2.7", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.DES)
RC2: "RC2", "1.2.840.113549.3.2", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.RC2)
To save the key in PuTTY format, pass the "putty" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.
To save the key on OpenSSH/OpenSSL SSLeay format, pass the "ssleay" or "openssh" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.

member.name: M:Rebex.Net.SshPrivateKey.Save(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Saves the private key into the specified file in Base64-encoded PKCS #8 format.
member.param: A path to stream to which to save the private key.
Password to encrypted the private key, or null if no encryption desired.

member.remarks:

TripleDES: null, "3DES", "TripleDES", "1.2.840.113549.3.7", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDES)
DES: "DES", "1.3.14.3.2.7", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.DES)
RC2: "RC2", "1.2.840.113549.3.2", typeof(System.Security.Cryptography.RC2)
To save the key in PuTTY format, pass the "putty" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.
To save the key on OpenSSH/OpenSSL SSLeay format, pass the "ssleay" or "openssh" string to the encryptionAlgorithm argument.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SshSession.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the operation times out (specify -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out).
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is 60000 (60 seconds).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server. This also means that data transfers only time out after x milliseconds of inactivity, not after x milliseconds from the start of the transfer.
Minimal value is 1000. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.SshSession.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the session is connected.

remarks.p: This property returns the latest known state of the session. When it returns false, the session was either never connected, or no longer connected. When it returns true, the session was connected at the time of the last I/O operation.
Note: There is no guarantee that the session is still connected even though returns true.

member.name: P:Rebex.Net.TlsSocket.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time before the operation times out.
member.value: The length of time, in milliseconds, until the operation times out, or the value -1 or 0 to indicate that the request does not time out. Default is -1 (infinite).

remarks.p: The internal timeout counter is reset every time data is sent or received from to server.
The property only affects synchronous methods.
Minimal value is 500. Setting this to a value lower than 1000 will set it to 1000.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificatePolicy
member.summary: Specifies the certificate policy for the server sockets.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificatePolicy.NoClientCertificate
member.summary: Don't request a client certificate.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificatePolicy.AllowClientCertificate
member.summary: Request a client certificate, but do not fail if none is provided.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificatePolicy.RequireClientCertificate
member.summary: Request a client certificate and fail if none is provided.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificateAcceptance
member.summary: Specifies certificate acceptance values.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificateAcceptance.Accept
member.summary: A certificate is to be accepted.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificateAcceptance.CommonNameMismatch
member.summary: The certificate common name does not match the server's name.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificateAcceptance.RevocationCheckFailed
member.summary: Unable to perform revocation check of the server certificate.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificateAcceptance.UnsupportedSignatureAlgorithm
member.summary: The certificate chain contains a certificate with unsupported signature hash algorithm (usually SHA-2).

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificateAcceptance.Bad
member.summary: A certificate is corrupt, contains signatures that do not verify correctly, etc.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificateAcceptance.Unsupported
member.summary: A certificate is of an unsupported type.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificateAcceptance.Revoked
member.summary: A certificate was revoked by its signer.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificateAcceptance.Expired
member.summary: A certificate has expired or is not currently valid.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificateAcceptance.UnknownAuthority
member.summary: A CA certificate could not be found or untrusted CA.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsCertificateAcceptance.Other
member.summary: Some other issue arose in processing the certificate, rendering it unacceptable.

member.name: T:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions
member.summary: Specifies secure connection options.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions.None
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions.DoNotCacheSessions
member.summary: Do not cache any sessions.
member.remarks: Mostly useful for debugging purposes.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions.StayConnected
member.summary: This option is no longer supported.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions.DoNotInsertEmptyFragment
member.summary: Do not send empty record after successful handshake with CBC ciphers.
member.remarks: For compatibility with broken implementations.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions.SkipRollbackDetection
member.summary: Ignore the client version in premaster secret. This only affects server sockets.
member.remarks: For compatibility with broken client implementations.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions.SilentUnprotect
member.summary: Forces the method to do immediate unprotect without exchange of CloseNotify alert messages. This is in violation of the RFC, but some broken servers need it, unfortunately.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions.Reserved
member.summary: This option is currently unused.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions.AllowCloseWhileNegotiating
member.summary: Causes an exception not to be thrown when a socket is closed by the server during negotiation. Instead, the negotiation will appear as successful, followed by an immediate socket closure.
member.remarks: This is needed by Serv-U FTP server that behaves like this when downloading an empty file or directory listing. Even though this behavior is almost certainly bad and could pose a potential security threat, we have to enable this option for this server to be able to work with it.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions.SilentClose
member.summary: Forces the method to do immediate close without exchange of CloseNotify alert messages. This is in violation of the RFC, but some broken servers (IIS with TLS 1.1) need it, unfortunately.

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions.DisableRenegotiationExtension
member.summary: Disables Renegotiation Indication Extension (RFC 5746).

member.name: F:Rebex.Net.TlsOptions.DisableServerNameIndication
member.summary: Disables Server Name Indication Extension (RFC 6066).
